intro: Pachira faroensis, commonly known as the Faroe pachira, is a species of flowering plant native to the Faroe Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Pachira faroensis is adapted to the cool, maritime climate of the Faroe Islands and is relatively rare in cultivation.
